In some ways I think that it is unfortunate that in ranked you might end up in a situation where all the champs you normally play have been banned. However I like the idea that at a Pro level they can have a greater pool of champs play in games making it more interesting to watch and that at a lower level of ranked we can have games where we have less of the champs that stomp because poorer players can't counter their few weaknesses.

As a Bard main I usually like to ban Lux as she is strong mid and is a massive counter to my play style when she is a support. If I get a ban like everyone else in my team then assuming the other players also ban champs that counter their own chosen champ then I get to have a ban anyway.

In order to play ranked you need a pool of 16 champs and I think being able to play more than 2 or 3 of them is important

Just cross posting for visibility. Obviously the article mentions some considerations and differences between pro play (organised play) vs regular match made games.

"The other factor is that we also need everyone to be using the new client before we can make pick/ban changes. That's easy for pro play, it'll be a little while yet though before that's the case for regular games.

 Meddler  - about 10 hours ago"

So before 10 bans comes to regular play for us commoners we will need to 

A) Assess what makes sense for ranked taking into account the differences between pro play and ranked play. (especially finding a way to do it without increasing the time it takes to get into game.)

B) We need all players on the new client

I like the idea. People whining about all their champs getting banned might need to use a larger variety of champs. 

It does get pretty boring watching the same bunch of champs get banned, same champs for contested picking and a handful of oddball champs that get played infrequently. If this makes pro play (and later on, ranked games) more interesting then bring it on.

If champions were more evenly balanced the need for bans would be redundant. Only "OP" champs get banned! No one bans a Rammus because he's to powerful. The idea that the game can be won or lost in champion select is ridiculous, and defeats the purpose of having a game at all.
I do like the fact that with 10 bans the champion pool will be massive now but it will lower the amount of some champions even being played at all.

This really seems like something people who grind solo queue would complain about, they all want a ban and honestly just pick random stuff they recently lost against. On a competitive level it just lowers the decision making between prioritising the tiny pool of actually "broken" champs and target banning the enemy teams carry.
Have you considered giving a ban to a specific item, keystone mastery or even summoner spell? Banning Courage of the Colossus for a game for example would just completely change the top lane champ pool for example. 
Although Mastery bans would probably mean more time is needed before actual games starts and having the power to ban Flash would just ruin any mid or adc's day lol.

They would need to have 30-40 of each summoner spell and keystone before this could ever happen and ultimately at that stage banning them would be completely useless due to other just as good options that would need to be in place, also it would be better to just nerf courage rather than outright ban it and make most tank champions almost unplayable to due undying grasp being as bad as it is on most champions, ultimately being able to ban summoner spells and masteries would make the game way less diverse as you could make any 2 classes of champs unplayable (both teams would have to get atleast 1 ban) imagine trying to play top lane as a player with low mechanical skill but very good decision making without teleport or courage, you would be forced onto mechanical champs and probably feed.

I agree that something needs to be done with the game, Recently I have stopped watching pro-players as every time you watch you see the same team comp and its became so boring... Just have a look at the previous games at Worlds 2016 pretty much every single game you knew who they would pick and banned. 

However I don't think it will fixed the issue. I would let pro-players play their preferred champ only once per game (if its best of 3 or 5 series) and make it as a rule for all Pro Matches. Sounds a bit harsh maybe but I think it could be fun to watch again.

With non pro play, the normal ranked queue games, will these two mid bans be given to the two people who didn't get to ban in phase 1? or is it going to be an issue where one person gets three bans, two get one and two people have to suffer watching useless bans to a higher extent. Personally I think it's just going to bring back the hyper carry days because there are now so many champions available that have that hard peel and can work with a hyper carry. Be better to just implement the 5 bans from the start, so it forces teams to diversify as 3 picks before banning again still gives the teams their core for anything really. Jungle and bot lane will likely be the first lanes picked time after time, as picking a mid and top early gives way to much time for counter picks, This feels like a gimmick, a gimmick that is diverting attention from development of the client, the endless bugs and lack of returning features.

> "The amount of time it takes to get into a game is also a particularly big concern for regular games, given we’re already getting a lot of feedback that time from pressing ‘Play’ to actually starting the game feels too long. Some of the options we’re looking at include reduced time in champ select as a focus as a result."

The new DOTA client is incredibly fast at getting players into the game (don't play it, just know). They load the game in the background during Champ select. This mean they don't need to do the separate load screen as LoL does. A similar loading solution would dramatically improve player exp in LoL.
